properties.name: Ben's Germantown Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay 14501 Schaeffer Rd, Germantown, MDWednesday, March 14th, Departing @ 4:45-5pm from South Germantown Park (Soccer Plex Area). The loop is 2hrs on the dot and I plan to ride it at a nice tempo (sub-TT pace). Would love company and would love to make this a regular ride. I work close to Olney -- if you live / work in the area, we could also do a nice 2hr loop around Olney (maybe Thursdays??). Contact me off-list if you are interested: ben AT drinkmorewater.com

properties.name: Davidsonville Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay Davidsonville, MDTuesdays and Thursdays at 6:00 pm sharp from the Davidsonville Park and Ride lot just off of RT 50. Fast 30-35 mile ride with a few moderate hills and paceline work on Rt 2. A somewhat scenic ride on smooth and rarely used (no cars) roads.

properties.name: Goon Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay Beach Dr and Garrett Park Road, Kensington, MD 20895Tuesday and Thursdays at 6pm, starting at Daylight Savings Time in the Spring. Fast as a bat out of, um, Kensington.

properties.name: Hains Point Lunchtime Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay On Mondays through Fridays between 12:05 to 1:00, you can find riders from DC Velo and many other local teams doing laps at Hains Point. The ride goes all year round. Pace is from easy spinning to Zone 5 when the big boys show up. Expect lots of rotating pace-line work. During the winter months, you\'ll see fixed gear and track bikes. Directions: Hains Point is in East Potomac Park near the Tidal Basin in the District. There is parking by the tennis courts and along the road bordering the Washington Channel, but most folks just ride their bikes to the ride start. Ride departs from the gate by the entrance to the golf course on the Washington Channel side promptly at 12:05.via: http://www.dcvelo.com

properties.name: MacAruthur Teardrop
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay3403 M Street NW, Washington, DC 20007a nice 30 mile 2 hour ride at social pace. 1:40 at a good clip, but you\'ll get stuck at a few stoplights. and not bad with 2,125 feet of ascent. easily justifiable mid day route. Route map: http://maps.google.com/maps?q=http://trail.motionbased.com/trail/kml/episode.kml?episodePkValues=2180074 via: http://www.christianleask.com

properties.name: Reston Thursday Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay Station St & Lynn St, Herndon, VA 20170The Tuesday/Thursday rides have been a popular, ongoing event for many years now. These rides are organized by Ken Thompson. The Tuesday/Thursday rides run spring to fall from the beginning to end of daylight savings time (for 2007, Mar 11 - Nov 4) . Courses vary week to week for ride levels from A to C. --Thursday rides start at 6PM (5:30 early start) at the parking lot across from the caboose on the W&OD trail in Herndon. via: http://www.restonbikeclub.org/

properties.name: Reston Tuesday Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay 2304 Hunters Woods Plaza Reston, VA The Tuesday/Thursday rides have been a popular, ongoing event for many years now. These rides are organized by Ken Thompson. The Tuesday/Thursday rides run spring to fall from the beginning to end of daylight savings time (for 2007, Mar 11 - Nov 4) . Courses vary week to week for ride levels from A to C. --Tuesday rides start at 6PM (also 5:30 early start) at the Hunters Woods Shopping Center in Reston. via: http://www.restonbikeclub.org/

properties.name: Saturday Morning 7am Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay Route 410 & Beach Drive, Chevy Chase, MDFor the early risers who need to be home before noon, try the Saturday 7:00 AM ride. This ride leaves from Rt. 410 (East West Highway) and Beach Drive (near Candy Cane City) every Saturday morning at 7:10 am. The ride meanders to the Massachusetts Avenue hill from Goldsboro, then pace-lines out to the Old Anglers Inn hill (on MacArthur), and down into Great Falls Park and back out. Thereafter some riders retrace their path down MacArthur making a left turn for the ascent up Brickyard Road, while other riders head down Falls Road. The ride regroups at Brickyard Road and Falls Road. There\'s one final push coming in on Democracy Boulevard before the ride heads back to East West Highway and Beach Drive. This ride ends when riders get back to East West Highway and Beach Drive. Often some riders veer off in Potomac Village and go out to Poolesville or Sugarloaf, making for a 60+ mile ride (the regular loop is about 40 miles). As with all rides, the rules for this ride are respect for fellow riders, motorists, and pedestrians, and observing all traffic signs.Approximate Distance/Time: 40 miles/2.5 hours. Ride goes year round.via: http://www.dcvelo.com

properties.name: The Bicycle Place Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay 8313 Grubb Road, Silver Spring, MD 20910Sundays 8:30 am. One of the best, large group rides in the DC area -- well organized, strong tradition of waiting for stragglers at the top of the 2 hardest climbs, friendly atmosphere, not much racer \'attitude\'. See thebicycleplace.com for details.

properties.name: Weekend 10am Rock Creek Ride
properties.description: Posted by Mdotmay Beach Dr NW & Broad Branch Rd NW, Washington, DCOn Saturdays and Sundays a mixed group of riders meets at the gate on Beach Drive and Broad Branch Road (just north of Peirce Mill on Beach Drive). Ride heads north though Rock Creek Park, out Tuckerman Lane, to Glen and beyond to Seneca. Pace in the park is mellow, picking up substantially at Tuckerman. The group tends to go hard over hills on Glen and beyond. Some riders cut the ride short, turning around at Travilah. Approximate Distance/Time: 40-50 miles/2.5-3 hours. Ride goes year round. via: http://www.dcvelo.com
